properties.description:
This Data Flow does the following:
1. Take in a Movies csv file with 6 columns stored in ADLS
2. Renaming one column and dropping another
3. Filtering out movies released before 1900
4. Deriving the primary genre as a new column from the existing genres column
5. Windowing over year and primary genre to rank movies based on their Rotten Tomatoes rating
6. Aggregating Movies based on year and primary genre to figure out average rating and the highest/lowest rated movies
7. Specifying an Upsert condition
8. Writing to a SQL DW sink

typeProperties.script:
source(output(
		movie as string,
		title as string,
		genres as string,
		year as string,
		Rating as string,
		{Rotton Tomato} as string
	),
	allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false) ~> MoviesADLS
AggregateRatings alterRow(upsertIf(true())) ~> UpsertIfTrue
FilterYearsBefore1950 derive(PrimaryGenre = iif(locate('|', genres) > 1, left(genres, locate('|', genres) - 1), genres)) ~> DerivePrimaryGenre
DerivePrimaryGenre window(over(PrimaryGenre,
		year),
	desc({Rotten Tomato}, true),
	RatingsRank = rank()) ~> RankMoviesByRatings
RankMoviesByRatings aggregate(groupBy(PrimaryGenre,
		year),
	AverageRating = avg(toInteger({Rotten Tomato})),
		HighestRated = first(title),
		LowestRated = last(title),
		NumberOfMovies = count()) ~> AggregateRatings
MoviesADLS select(mapColumn(
		movie,
		title,
		genres,
		year,
		{Rotten Tomato} = {Rotton Tomato}
	)) ~> SelectAndRename
SelectAndRename filter(toInteger(year) > 1950) ~> FilterYearsBefore1950
UpsertIfTrue sink(input(
		PrimaryGenre as string,
		year as string,
		AverageRating as double,
		HighestRated as string,
		LowestRated as string,
		NumberOfMovies as long
	),
	allowSchemaDrift: false,
	validateSchema: false,
	format: 'table',
	staged: true,
	deletable:false,
	insertable:false,
	updateable:false,
	upsertable:true,
	keys:['PrimaryGenre','year'],
	partitionBy('hash', 1)) ~> SinkToDW
